Authors:
Alcindo Silva Martins Jr, Cassia Monica Sakuragui, Helen
Maria Pontes Sotão, Anibal Alves Carvalho Jr
Title: Two new species of Phakopsora from Brazil
Keywords:
Pucciniales, Taxonomy, Uredinales, Rust fungi,
Phakopsoraceae
Abstract:
Phakospora is one of the most important genera of
Pucciniales because of its high species number, many of which cause rust
on economically important plants. Two new species of this genus,
Phakopsora cerradensis and Phakopsora maragaritariana on Panicum sp. and
Margaritaris nobilis, respectively, are described in this paper.
Molecular data from rDNA region ITS2-28S partial were accessed to
examine their phylogenetic relationships among Phakopsoraceae species,
whose sequences were available in online database. Lenticular telia,
slightly concave hymenium and thickened apical wall of distal
teliospores (2-3um) are distinctive features of Ph. cerradensis which
showed little affinity with Phakopsora species available in online
dataset and used for molecular analysis. Ph. margaritariana is the first
species of rust fungi on M. nobilis, differing from other Phakopsora
spp. on Phyllanthaceae species due to unusual size of its urediniospores
(1923×1218um) and apical thickening of distal teliospores (57um). This
species displays to be closely related to Phakopsora crucis-filii.
Morphologically and phylogenetically both new species are considered as
taxonomically distinct units and independent lineages.
